intro: Senecio hjertingii, commonly known as the Hjerting's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by tufted seed heads. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
